review: It's been years since I've been to a CPK. I just couldn't pass up the opportunity. Despite it being a busy Saturday before Christmas, we were seated right away.  Our waitress was fantastic, she was fast, attentive and efficient. The warm bread she brought to the table was baked to perfection. We started with the buffalo cauliflower. Basically baked cauliflower coated with a spicy buffalo sauce, blue cheese and green onions. It was actually amazing. My BBQ chicken salad was huge (full size), I splurged and added avocado which was a nice addition. It also included jicama, which is hard to come by at most restaurants. All in all was a great salad, although pricey coming in at just under $20. But can you really put a price on a good salad?!? My husband ordered the shrimp and garlic pizza. The crust is their signature thin crust pizza. It was good, but was a little dry and suffered from too much cheese (yes, you can have too much cheese).  We had a great meal and were in and out in less than an hour, so overall a great experience.

We walked up to the hostess..desk? Pulpit? And watched as several employees buzzed around looking at a schedule while we stood in silence, hoping to be honored with acknowledgement. After several minutes a woman looked up and stared expectedly, as if daring me to speak first.  "Two?", she finally asked. "Yes." I said smiling. And then with no further instruction we stood there for another five minutes while her and the other employees planned their heist to break into the Capitol to steal the Declaration of Independence. Or rather, discuss further the table situation, with exasperated looks on all their faces as if two human beings weren't standing before them. A different woman eventually sat us, and as I looked around I noticed stacks of dirty dishes sitting on the condiment table behind us. They were there the WHOLE time. So many employees walked by. Yet the dishes remained... We were brought our appetizer and give two plates, both dirty. One with an actual piece of food the size of my palm smashed on to it. Perhaps bread? Maybe not. We told our server who responded, "UGH." As if to show disgust without concern. We quickly ate our clearly frozen prepared appetizer and politely paid the bill and ran out the door, never to return.

Very disappointed.  It was my sisters birthday, and our family gathered for what was supposed to be a nice dinner. It took almost 10 minutes for anyone to come to our table to get our drinks. Or even say "I'll be right with you" she just looked at us. Meanwhile, she is standing and talking to another table.  That was the first thing that put me off. Jacky was her name. Before she brings out drinks, she greets another table and brings their drinks and bread. We get our drinks, no bread. We had to ASK for it.  Another 10-15 minutes goes by, doesn't offer appetizers, and we had to flag her to get our order. I was very pressed for time, and didn't appreciate being made to wait 25 minutes just to get bread and something to drink.  I was able to put in my order with appetizers, and she did bring out my meal first. However, I had to ask for a box THREE times, between the second and third, she boxed up ANOTHER TABLES food (the one that got their after us, and she clearly felt deserved more attention) My sister, finally said something. As well as a few of the people I was with. It was just embarrassing that we recommended this place, and she had to talk to the Waitress Jacky not once, but THREE TIMES!  It's VERY rare that I don't tip. I OVER tip because I've been a server and been there! But there was ZERO excuse for the way she treated us-they weren't busy, it's a Monday night.  When we spoke to a manager, she simply made excuses for the server.  I am very unhappy about my experience here today, and not sure if I will return. It's a shame because I Loooooove the Jambalaya! I would rather drive to Chesterfield than have to deal with service this poor again.

We had a great time here. Our server was great. Food was hot and served fresh. We ordered the Margherita pizza and our daughter had the kids cheese. They served us bread with olive oil dipping sauce while we waited for our food.

I've been eating at this CPK (ie California Pizza Kitchen)location for years.... and typically they do a really good job! CPK has made some menu improvements in the last few years and a few blunders! First the positives: While It may be called California PIZZA Kitchen do Not be confused, While CPK has some tasty Pizzas (Which I always considered non traditional wood fired pizzas with very different ingredients) *Their Salads and Pastas are top notch! The Chinese Chicken salad,and The *Seasonal Strawberry Fields salad (See Pic!)  Pasta: CPKs  1.)Fettuccine (Your choice of protein) =Nice garlic cream sauce. One of the best Fettuccines around! 2.) Kung Pow Spaghetti (a personal fave!)  chicken, green onions,cayenne in a flavorful peanut sauce (I personally have them hold the actual peanut topping) .... You may be apprehensive to try this the first time but IMO it is amazing and waitress said they sell a Lot of it! Secret to the Pasta Dishes?= Perfectly al dente pasta!! CPK gets points for adding new and diverse menu items over the past few years.  Bread w Olive Oil w spices is ok Missteps: = Mainly in desert dept: (eg they HAD one of the better Tiamasu deserts=Gone and Flourless Chocolate soufflé while still here, used to be fresh and now tastes prefab microwaved!

Sana was a great server; very friendly, accommodating and prompt. Our pizzas were delicious and arrived just as we'd ordered. Hand tossed BBQ Chicken original with bacon and a Cali. Veggie with goat cheese. The Brussels & Bacon flatbread was another hit amongst my dining partners.  CPK also has a kids menu which doubles as a coloring book, equipped with 3 crayons to occupy the kiddos while the adults converse.  Plenty of dining both indoors and out, a full bar, herb garden display upon entry and hosts stationed to greet you at arrival. I was able to make reservations for my party of 5...it's important that I slide right in.  ~Christy

I went there with a friend who was shopping at Galleria Mall just to grab a drink and something to snack. California Pizza Kitchen does not offer a happy hour, although they have a pretty large selection of cocktails ($9.99). I had a Moscow Mule (pretty classic right?), I thought it was too sweet. My friend had a ginger strawberry cocktail, too sweet as well.  We ordered a plate of 3 Tortilla Spring Rolls. I thought the spring rolls, the waitress described us bigger portion but it was way smaller. You have the choice to mix different rolls, so we ordered one of each : Mediterranean Veggie (mushrooms, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, Mozzarella and Parmesan and marinara sauce on the side), Baja Chicken (with Monterey Jack cheese,  Cheddar, corn, black beans, poblanos, red onions and cilantro, with housemade guacamole on the side) and Thai Chicken (with Peanut sauce, bean sprouts, scallions, carrots, cilantro and Mozzarella and Peanut sauce on the side). Those rolls were tasty, I liked the Thai chicken one the most. I may try their pizza next time if I'm around.  The service was awesome though, Steph was very sweet.

Dinner at the bar last Monday evening was splendid. I had my usual, the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza with a strawberry iced tea. It was all delicious. Athough at times during my meal, I wanted something and the bartender (my server) had disappeared, the service still wasn't bad. There were also large TVs throughout the bar and dining room which nice to watch while dining. Getting back to the service though, I inquired about CPK's reward program. I handed the Bartender my filled out card to get me started and he mis-entered my phone number into the system when setting my account up. Teh way that you're found in teh system is by phone number so as of now, when I'm asked for my phone number, they won't be able to find me in the system. Thanks a lot sir..... He apologized and said that I'd have to change it online, and that he's not able to change it in the system. That seems weird to me seeing how he was able to create the account, but oh well.

Ordered pepperoni pizza which was really tasty. For a chain restaurant this place impresses. I ordered ahead and the food was prepared in the time that was given to me, which is always a plus. Downside, is their curbside service to go. When you pull up to the parking spot, you have to call a number. Debatable if it is an actual St. Louis number. When I called, the person on the other line seemed confused. I waited for a few minutes and no one came out. I finally had to go in to retrieve my order. I was in a hurry, which is why I thought he curbside would have been convenient. It's not the worst thing in the world, but just put a small dent in my plans since I was really on the go. Great place though!

We stopped here for lunch after running errands all morning.  We were seated promptly, but unfortunately the seat was wet.  Apparently someone had wiped it off but didn't dry it.  Oh well, I won't melt.  Jenee was our waitress and she did a wonderful job. We decided to do the half and half (I think they called it the duo).  We each got half of a salad (me a Caesar, him a super spinach + quinoa).  We both decided on the oven roasted turkey with brie sandwich.  Both our salads were good but each of us agreed that we could have used just a bit more dressing.  The sandwich was delicious but I agreed with our waitress who said she thought it would be better if it had cranberry chutney on it.  All in all, it was a good lunch and fueled us for the rest of our day. Would I come back here?  Yes I would because it's a great place to grab lunch.

Simply wonderful pizza! My family loves this wonderful restaurant!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend going to this restaurant. Would I come back? Definitely!!!!! It's a great place to grab a snack or even have lunch. Best of all my kids love it! You should come to California Pizza Kitchen! Though the restaurant itself is great our waitress forgot to ask the kitchen for our appetizer. Despite my review this is overall a great restaurant
It's CPK.  It's decent pizza but a little pricey for what it is.  No provel here (I'm pretty sure) so that's a positive in my book.

I am giving this 4 star review based solely on the polite hostess and the good food.  However, the service seriously sucked.  We were a party of 3....Mother-in-Law, Daughter-in-Law(Me) and my 26year old daughter.  We are all well versed in restaurant etiquette and were not greeted with the same from our waiter. The first time he arrived at our table he wanted to take our food order.  I politely told him that we were not ready but we would like to order our beverages at which point he rolled his eyes!  We never were offered refills on our drinks until we flagged him down.  When I requested more bread and oil for my Mother-in-Law to accompany her salad he acted annoyed.  When he brought it he slammed it down on the edge of our table and didn't even take the empty plate!  My 89 year old MIL was so upset.  We got the message loud and clear from him that he was not happy to be waiting on a group of women....well we always tip 20 percent and after he got his tip and we were done eating and just chatting he could not have been nicer....refilling water and ice tea!!!!!  We spent a lot of money to be disrespected by this twerp!!!!

Great service and love being able to people watch while I eat! The food is consistently delicious, and I love the menu - the pizzas are diverse and the serving sizes are more than enough for fun leftovers the next day (or late night snack!). This CPK is one of my favorite's. So I'll definitely I'll back!
Husband and I split a spinach artichoke dip appetizer and a pizza. The dip was great but the pizza was just okay. Probably would not go back.

This was great! Went here for the first time before a helium comedy club show just yesterday. Service is great - everybody is very friendly and wants to make sure you are enjoying your meal. All the pizzas are 11 inches so I split one with my boyfriend and we got an appetizer as well. The appetizer we got was buffalo cauliflower something... it could have been chicken, the texture was great! The sauce is spicy but not too spicy and the bleu cheese really complimented it. I was skeptical about the cauliflower but now I'm going to try more cauliflower as a substitute type foods. And obviously the pizza was very good, crispy and flavorful. And to top it off we got a coupon for free dessert and little candies from the manager since it was our first time. Very impressed!

Got ignored by the waitress that was supposed to be helping us. Then another waiter cane over from another section and took care of us. Thank you Darius. Super nice and didn't have to move us to your section.

I was visiting family in St Louis, and while at the Galleria we stopped at California Pizza Kitchen,  I had never been to one before but I was very happy with my meal and the service we received.  Our server was very personable, and provided answers to any question we asked.  When we told him one member of our party had a nut allergy he informed her of everything that was safe to eat and even verified with the kitchen just to make sure.   Everyone was very happy that we went there and I look forward to a return trip in the future.
Just like others, the food is really good. The raspberry lemonade is my favorite. Service was a little slow but other than that it's great!

Manager Jackie is excellent and you can see it throughout her staff. They made my 45th Birthday last night an wonderful evening. They are more welcoming than Weber Grill and the food is reasonably priced and it was delicious. This is an not your regular pizza joint.

Every time we go there it is GREAT! we are not from St. Louis but we visit often. The staff is nice and professional and the ambiance is perfect. The food is always delicious no matter what you order. The CLUB pizza was yummy!!! Just an all around great place to eat .

Wow!  Everything about this place.  Wife and i are trying CPK for the first time.  They were busy (short wait) but the service was still friendly and fast (Nick was our waiter.)  The bread and oil was very good.  The Cesar salad was very good.  Got the half salad and it was still good portion.  Perfect amount of dressing, a lot of leafy greens, no hard middle pieces of the lettuce.  The BBQ Chicken pizza came out shortly after, & met our expectations.  Great flavor, plenty of chicken, & lots of bacon (extra.). Had a great BBQ flavor not overpowering. Defiantly a place we will come back to!

Well aware this is a chain, however this is my first time eating here. I'm sure any of these reviews could apply to any cpk in the Unites States. Our waiter surprised me with a little snack of chips and special Guacamole dip as a first time customer. Our food was fresh. I got the BBQ chicken salad, which I liked. I hate when salads are bland and have no nutrition to them. This salad was loaded with greens, tomatoes and avocados. Tried my wife's pizza. Yummy. All four of us dining together split the strawberry shortcake and oh my gosh it was incredible. A biscuit split in half a la mode with fresh berries. We devoured it.  Each entree I would say is large enough for two people and the desert was plenty for four of us. Seems like serving sizes keep getting bigger and bigger these days.  Awesome place. I could tell the ingredients are fresh and I walked away feeling healthy about what I ate. Will go again.

I would highly recommend the Signature Pepperoni pizza.  It is the perfect crust thickness and taste.  With all the different topping combinations, go figure that regular pepperoni is my favorite! The frozen version of this pizza in the grocery stores is only marginally close.

Had a very nice lunch today. Service was great. Food flavorful and filling. We had the pizza and Mediterranean salad; half quinoa and arugula salad with chicken breast and bowl of vegetable soup. The Bloody Mary was perfectly spice and the coffee was hot and plentiful. Finished it off with yummy dessert.

I just realized this place had a renovation. The place seemed bigger with kind of a rural pastoral design.  Friends and I decided to come here to have dinner on a early Friday evening. Place wasn't very crowded, we were here around 6pm.  We didn't order pizza this time, I think we've tried all the pizza on the menu already. We decided to go with pastas.  They now offer complimentary bread with olive oil and herbs. Bread could be warmer, it was crusty outside and soft inside, loved the olive oil.  I ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine - I really liked the hint of jalapenos lime sauce, not really spicy. Skimpy on the chicken.  Kung Pao Spaghetti with Chicken - took a bite from my friend's plate, didn't really like it.  Jambalaya Fettuccine with Chicken, Shrimp, Crawfish, Sausage and Ham - I am not a big fan of cajun sauce, can't comment on this one.  Average is about $12-$15 per dish.
Good place to grab a quick bite to eat. All the flat breads are great. Love the ambiance in the place, service wasn't stellar but just ok. Will return again!

While interviewing with a restaurant owner, he admitted that this chain was his favorite in St. Louis. I found that really, really hard to believe. I mean, there are some really great restaurants in St. Louis... Or, at least, so I hear.  Anyways, once said owner planted this seed in my head, I couldn't get pizza out of my head. I was taking part in some retail therapy and suggested we check out the "fresh" ingredients he told me about. The staff was friendly, really friendly. From the hostess, who basically let us pick our own table, to the honest and knowledgeable server, who took excellent care of us. Everyone was sunshine, puppy dogs and rainbows.  My date had two mini-appetizers, one was a dip of some sort (shows how memorable it was...) and the other was quesadillas. Neither were worth whatever she paid for them. Admittedly, the guacamole was fresh and chunky but the portion was really, really small. Smaller than tapas small. The quesadilla was just a joke. It was extra skinny and sad.... I, on the other hand, was hungry. I ordered a small starter salad. It was really great- loaded with candied nuts and the dressing was perfect. I also ordered a pizza to share. It was the special of the day (week? month?)... brussel sprouts, goat cheese and bacon! It sounded weird, but was, indeed tasty. The downfalls were that the bottom of my pizza was blackened, not burnt, but charred with way too many grill marks. I get it. A wood-fired pizza oven, or whatever, but I still don't need the taste of char to over power my entire pizza. What a disappointment. Furthermore, the pizza combination itself would have been far more balanced with a nice layer of olive oil (since there was no marinara), as goat cheese alone is very dry. I was inspired by the experience and intend to recreate the salad and the pizza at home.  All in all, customer service, however attentive and nice, is not enough to make me spend my hard earned cash. Three stars for trying.

I have eaten here twice with my boyfriend. Both visits were great service. The first visit our waiter was very conversational and friendly. He suggested the avocado spring rolls.  That guy KNEW what was up. My boyfriend and I ate those up before our food came which screwed up our appetite. :) But that is what to-go boxes are for! The next visit, the waitress was prompt and gave great service too. Our food came out in about ten-fifteen minutes. Not a long wait at all! And it was very busy when we were there. That's talent! This time I had the avocado spring rolls as my meal and my boyfriend had the jerk chicken pizza. His pizza was very juicy and I recognized that it tasted good but it's not the sort of flavour I clamor for. ;) He did beg me to share my avocado spring rolls. I'm not really a fan of their pizza but as long as they keep those rolls I will keep visiting! ;)

Went here to meet up with some friends in St. Louis! It's nice and well kept and the service is amazing! I was a little disappointed though to find that their pizza crust was really thin. It's most certainly a good place for a small group though!

Sit at the bar! When you sit at the bar you get to watch their open kitchen while people toss pizzas up in the air and slide them into their giant brick oven. It is pretty cool, and ensures they can't do something untoward to the dish you ordered :-) I really like their small plates menu - it is reasonably priced and has some yummy options - flatbreads, salads, some soups on occasion. I highly recommend their Sangria - both their red and white - both are delicious and come with a lot of tasty fruit to snack on as well. Though they are known for their BBQ pizza, I really dig their mushroom pizza and their spaghetti bolognese is a winner too. Good place to grab a nice drink and hot bite after some shopping around the Galleria with friends. Good place!

The food here is pretty good. The service is great; I came here with a large group and the waitress kept bringing back more bread for us to eat while we were waiting for our food to come. Like, a lot of bread, which made me a happy camper. The pizzas are very expensive, but they're the only very good thing on the menu, imo. I got the corn chips and guac, which was all right, and a salad. However, there are little to no vegetarian options here. I was disappointed. My meal was not filling.

The office ordered in for a working lunch yesterday. We used 569 Dine, which works based on the ZIP code of your delivery destination. The website shows all ZIP codes served, including the restaurants participating in delivery to each ZIP code. There is a $10 food minimum and a $5.50 delivery charge. If your order is more than $30, they automatically add a 10% gratuity. We were ordering for 5. Everybody thoroughly enjoyed their food. There was Sedona Tortilla Soup (and the tortilla strips were courteously in a separate container), Korean barbeque steak tacos, asparagus and spinach spaghettini (whole wheat) and Margherita pizza. I got the Wedge Salad. And tortilla spring rolls, two for $7.29. You could get 3 for $10.29. This is listed as an appetizer, so I thought a salad to go with it would work well. Tortilla spring rolls: I chose the Baja Chicken (diced chicken, Jack and Cheddar cheeses, black beans, mild chilies, red onions and cilantro with guac on the side) and the Mediterranean (grilled Portobello, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, Fontina, Mozzarella and Parmesan with sun-dried tomato marinara on the side). The flour tortillas were all herbed up. Delicious and crunchy (even through the packing and delivery time). Two spring rolls. How much food can that be? It was six or eight three-bite pieces. Huge. Filling. Delicious. Why is this an appetizer? The Wedge will wait for another day.

Overrated!!!!! My first and last time at this dirty dive. I ordered the brussel sprout pizza with caramelized onions. I expected more flavor from this place. All I can say is the pizza was just, OK. How do you mess up a sausage and pepperoni pizza???? Well just ask CPK. That was the nastiest, trifling pizza I have consumed that wasn't a frozen brand.
I liked them, the prices I don't I think they are alittle too high for pizzza, but they are good to eat, the service couldve been better....

Great food- not child-friendly The tortilla soup was amazing. Cobb salad was great, too, and a half salad is still very large. The server was great but the hosts were not happy about my two-year-old guest. They stated twice that they would store the stroller so it wasn't in their way, gave us a dirty high chair, then asked us to seat the child more inside the area so she wasn't in the way, even though she was out of the main walkway, it still wasn't out of the way enough. Great food- not child-friendly.
Colleagues forced me here a couple of times.  I'll eat anything called pizza, well almost everything.  I couldn't finish this pie; it was just poor in my opinion.

I hate this place. They mess up my order every single time I go. Very dissapointed, as someone who has been in other CPKs this one is no doubt not the best. The waiters are very nice and kind, at least.

Redecoration destroyed the place.  Feels like eating in a warehouse.  Interior dim yellow light decor does not work with white florescent Lighting coming in from Galleria entrance. Doesn't work to have that two story glass wall anymore.  Booths? Gone.  Art work? Gone.  Privacy? Gone!  Partitions ? Gone. Conversations at other tables easier to hear than at our own table. Noisy. Oh, and the food? Miso salad dressing? Gone. Other menu changes.  Someone must need a loss fast for some other reason. A real business killer set of changes. Yuk.

I love, love, love their pizza!!  I have for many years!! I call them designer pizzas and as much as I like a traditional pie I really love CPK pizza.  I have never had a bad pizza here and I even order extra pizzas and take them home to eat all week long. A must for a good lunch!!

I have always been a CPK fan-- for many years now.. I dont make it there often...at all.... but I do love it when I go. Yesterday my gf and I went there for lunch for a late birthday celebration-  and honestly--- everything about it was good, from the service, to the food, to the dessert--- why are people so hard on chain restaurants??  If its good, its good---- and i mean, i know, if its bad , its bad--- i get it. but, I had a pleasurable experience--- and while I WILL say that $6 for a draft blue moon (a big one) is a TAD high IMO, the service was prompt, quick, attentive, and the ingredients on my pizza were indeed  fresh, and yummy!  I always stick to the pizza I have loved for many years, and that is the  Thai Chicken Pizza....SO GOOD!! :)  And it more than satisfied my craving for CPK-- So CPK I commend  you on giving me a good experience---  My beer was cold, my pizza was hot, and the dessert was scrumptious!  My gf ordered the tiramisu, and while I am not a huge sweet eater, I thought it was really good.... and I am by no means a tiramisu expert---  So people, cut the chains a break wouldya!?

I love coming to CPK, but only for the appetizers like dips, soups, and salads. I've always thought this company was misnamed. With all the outstanding cities known for having excellent pizza (New York, Chicago, St. Louis, etc.) why on earth would California try to compete with this? It only hurts their business. Nobody ever travels to California to try their pizza and there is a reason for this: people go to California to eat healthy, tasty, hippy dippy food! That's what California is known and loved for! So why not capitalize on this? The apps and entrees  at CPK are some of the best anywhere! I say the company should be renamed CTK: California Tapas Kitchen!

Today, I've decided to give them another chance and had lunch there.  Because the district manager replied to my prior negative review about not getting breads.  They request another chance.   The service was excellent, and without asking they gave us breads.  The waiter was very attentive.  Two thumbs up.  Keep up the good work!

I didn't come here with Mallory W with the idea they would have superb pizza. I already know cpk is pretty generic, so I can't expect too much. I did expect good service, but we didn't even get that.  It felt like our waiter was seriously on his first day there because he was clumsy, and forgetful, among other things. He brought out my appetizer salad with my meal, which I hate! I should never have to ask someone when my appetizer is coming out, but these days I feel like I'm being forced to because of epically bad service everywhere. Anyway, our food was as expected, good, but not orgasmic. The kicker of it all was when he brought our checks and I couldn't find my credit card. Our waiter disappeared into thin air, so I was left to find it on my own.  I found out he dropped it by the register.  That was the last straw. He got a terrible tip from us both and I will most likely never return.

Not normally a fan of corporate pizza places, but I must say my last visit introduced me to their salad selections.  I was very impressed with my lunch of a BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad, and the manager Ali was delightful to speak to.

SO WHAT IF ITS A CHAIN. DELICIOUS. I kinda play it safe here. I don't really venture out of what I know I like. I'm afraid it won't be good. Their salads just look like something from Applebees, and I never have good luck with Applebees, so even though they sound good I never get it. Point taken away for the bread they bring out. Cold sourdough. Come on, at least be warm? But at least they bring you bread, I guess. I always order the Wild Mushroom Pizza. It is so delicious. Packed with tender wild mushrooms and that sweet crispy crust is to die for. My fingers, I lick them clean. Also, their flavored lemonades...free refills! Win! She kept bringing them out when I was halfway done with a glass, and at first I was annoyed because the last one she brought out I wasn't even going to touch, but then she offered a to-go cup for it. Awesomeeee. I'm a sucker for good service - our waitress was attentive even though she was very busy, and the manager visited our table. Cool points. CPK, I like you. Stay classy.

Food was OK but service was quite terrible. And we were only doing carryout! Girlfriend got sent back and forth between several people. They were at least 20 minutes late with the estimated order they gave us. And then when we left we found out that they missed one pizza completely and didn't give it to us. Upon returning back we got told that they gave us everything and only upon insisting that one was missing the bothered to check the drawer by the kitchen. And there was our pizza. Hostess just shrugged, gave it to us and went on with her other tasks. No apology or anything...
Although I steer away from chain places, every once in a while I get the craving for a BBQ chicken pizza or salad and CPK's hit the spot.  Service has always been good.

I love how to get to the restaurant i have to pass the pretzel place because it smells so good and it makes me more hungry.  it was busy lunch hour so we had to wait 15 minutes and there was no more bench space outside.  the waiter was very friendly and she got us our water right away even though there were a lot of people. we got some bread and olive oil and i really like the decoration; they have an oversized lantern big enough to fit 20 obese tinkerbells.  Anyway, we ordered the waldorf CHICKEN salad and the hawaiian bbq chicken pizza. i liked how the waiter asked us if we wanted the salad first or everything together-- they're supposed to ask but i think they always forget. Everything was amazingg except for the fact that they forgot to put chicken in the chicken salad lol lol... we let the waiter know and the manager came over and very kindly offered his apologies and let us have the salad for free, which despite being chicken-less, was still very, very tasty and i would definitely recommend it! the pizza was delicious and we asked for ranch, i think they charge 50 cents for that. all in all, we had a great experience!  i am also pleased that the hawaiian pizza is a chicken pizza since anything with pineapple or named hawaiian usually comes with ham.

The changes here over the years have not been for the better.  The decor is industrial and cold.  The tables look as though they tried to shove as many seats in as possible.  It was so haphazard, we had to walk a circuitous route in several directions just to get to our table.  They have wine glasses that they leave on the table for the duration of the meal- lunch in this case.  Don't think CPK is that type of place, especially for lunch.  It took ten minutes for a waiter to say hello, another ten for our beers and to place our order, and another forty five for the pizza to arrive.  When it did, I had to get the bill and a couple of boxes so we could make it to the movie we wanted to see at the Galleria Cinema, luckily just right down the hall.  All this and it wasn't very crowded.   The menu has changed as well- the prices are higher, many of their bests salads and dressings are gone.  They also try to upsell every pizza.  I asked if the Habanero Carnitas had cheese on it...it doesn't but they can add some for a charge.  Hmmm...not really going to pay for cheese on my pizza, something I consider a standard ingredient even on a gourmet pizza.  So I asked for the traditional BBQ chicken and was asked if I wanted to add bacon.  Ummm, no thanks, again!  Bacon, although delicious, doesn't even sound that great on a BBQ chicken pizza.  And that's saying something!   I wound up having to sneak my pizza in to the movie since they don't want outside food in the theaters.  Obviously by this point I was starving but was not going to buy something else when I had a whole pizza!  Luckily it wasn't too hard to sneak in and it was easy to eat watching the movie.

Bad experience saturday night 6/25. Cold pizza worst mango colada, got my throat clogged and choked . There was no apology she just picked the pizzAA and threw it back in the microwave, and it became worst.

Started off 2015 with lunch at CPK. The new lunch duos menu shows originality as well as some fallback options for the gastronomically challenged. The offerings are affordable and give a wide range of choices: soup and salad; soup or salad and sandwich; soup or salad and 7 inch pizza. We had the super spinach + Quinoa salad features tender spinach, cranberries, crisp Granny Smith apples and spiced pecans. It's a nice balance of flavors and textures that's more interesting than a run of the mill salad. A guest had the Caesar topped with a generous amount of shaved Parmesan. Both salads came with warm sour dough bread and olive oil infused with spices.  I ordered the 7 inch sausage pepperoni mushroom pizza and a guest ordered CPK's signature BBQ chicken pizza. The pizza crust is impressive - thick, tender but firm, and both pizzas were topped with lots of cheese. The server, Katrina, added even more freshly-grated Parmesan. Yum.  It helps too that Katrina, was lovely and accommodating. Portions are munificent so plan for leftovers, if you're not a big eater.
the service is a tad slow  i have eaten at this CPK for years now. Also the mall has gone way DOWN hill ! lots of gangster wannabes here !

CPK is one of my favorites. I'm always satisfied with my pizza no matter what I choose. I usually get the classic BBQ Chicken pizza, but when I'm feeling adventurous, I'll get the Thai pizza. Both are big favorites of mine. I've also had the 5-Cheese and tomato pizza and the Sausage pizza. I guess it really just depends on my mood what I want to eat. The bread they serve before the meal is decent. There's really nothing special about it.  The wait staff is usually pretty friendly, but I've definitely had a few waitresses who did not meet my expectations. For the most part, I've been satisfied.

The last time I was here I thought that they still had the Peking Duck pizza, but they got rid of it!  Other than that, the Singapore Shrimp Rolls, Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and pizza are pretty good.  Pizza was kind of light to me.  The price was a bit high for the quantity that you get.

Some part of me feels guilty when I give a pizza chain like CPK a higher review than beloved local establishments like Pi or Pointer's. But, you know, it's not my fault my taste buds work this way. CPK is, without a doubt, my favorite fast-casual dining chain. There.  I said it.  I love California Pizza Kitchen. Okay... that wasn't so hard.  I just need to shut out the snobby part of my brain and come to grips with the fact that I really love their chicken Waldorf salad with dijon balsamic vinaigrette.  I love their mango tandoori pizza.  I love their broccoli and sun-dried tomato fusilli. Wait a minute... according to their website, it would seem that they've gotten rid of their mango tandoori pizza. NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! Still, I confess I like a number of their other pizzas.  I love their strawberry lemonade, but for some reason sugary drinks give me a crushing stomachache, so I can't drink it. They are a tad overpriced, I think.  But they are tasty...

My family and I ate here for lunch the other day, and it was delicious!  We've eaten at a lot of CPKs before, but this was definitely one of the best.  To start off with we got crab cakes, spinach dip, and cheese focacia bread.  The crab cakes were excellent along with the spinach dip and cheese focacia bread.  I got my usual which is the five cheese pizza with no tomatoes and no basil which was amazing as always.  The rest of my family enjoyed their meals too which included the Sicilian pizza, the chicken dumplings, and the Thai crunch salad.  The only thing that wasn't excellent was the cobb salad because the avocado was hard, and it was just okay.  Other than that it was a great lunch!

I review this one as opposed to a CPK that is actually in CA to make a point.  I think my point is that it isn't so Californian.  The first time I had CPK was when I was given a tour of my school in mo.   These two girls were to psyched to take me there.  You can imagine my dismay as I realized that 1)  chains in malls make me sad and 2) I missed California and real California cuisine.  No offense to Missouri because it has it's cool things.  I just believe this ain't one of them.  Every time I go here it is crowded and well, crowded and mall like.  And, did I mention that indoor malls make me sad?  Well, they do.
